A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
**spoilers**

First of all\, forget all of the dumb "fan theories" that have been floating around the Internet for the past 2 years\, we are still no closer to finding out who Rey's parents are. This film seemed to go out of its way to avoid answering any questions that we may have had at the end of TFA. So don't go to the cinema with any expectations of those being answered.

This film doesn't play it safe either\, Luke is bitter and is afraid of failure\, he is no longer the naive farm boy.Leia is still as tough in spirit as she always was\, and it was nice to see Leia use the Force for once. Both actors do an excellent job\, Mark is brilliant as Luke\, you can literally see the painfull memories etched into face as he tries to persuade Rey to leave. 

Carrie looks like she is carrying the weight of the galaxy on her shoulders\, as she should as Leia is still the leader of the Resistance\, who are very much the galaxies only hope. 

One special mention goes out to one scene in particular that had me in tears\, once you see the film you will know which one.

The rest of the cast are great as well\, although Finn I felt disappeared at some points. A special mentiuon goes out to Rey who is no longer the Mary Sue from TFA as she tries to persuade Luke to join the fight.

All in all\, I enjoyed this film\, it doesn't pander to the fans and follows it's own path while still stirring up memories from the original trilogy\, and even\, dare I say it\, making a man like feel a little bit emotional.
